meanings.definition: Past participle of 'outride': to ride faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outridden her friend in the race.
meanings.sent2: He has outridden all his competitors in the cycling competition.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outridden the hare in the slow and steady race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed has outridden any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The champion outridden all doubts to claim victory.

meanings.definition: Past participle of 'outride': to surpass or exceed in riding.
meanings.sent1: The skilled rider outridden everyone in the equestrian event.
meanings.sent2: Having trained hard, she has outridden her own previous record.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy outridden his reputation as the best rider in town.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for horseback riding has outridden her fear of falling.
meanings.sent5: He has outridden all expectations with his exceptional riding skills.

meanings.definition: Past participle of 'outride': to ride past or beyond something.
meanings.sent1: The cyclist outridden the finish line with a burst of speed.
meanings.sent2: The adventurous explorer has outridden many obstacles in his journey.
meanings.sent3: The knight outridden the dragon and saved the princess.
meanings.sent4: Her determination has outridden the challenges of the rough terrain.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner outridden his own limits to reach the end.
